ygData.subject: Re: Performance Sensitivity to float precision
ygData.msgSnippet: Steve, I don t know of specific experiments on this topic, but I believe for most applicaions single precision should be sufficient.  I say this because

Steve,

I don't know of specific experiments on this topic, but I believe 
for most applicaions single precision should be sufficient.  I say 
this because networks usually do not utilize the full precision of 
the continuum from 0 to 1 on the outputs.  For example, in robot 
duel most of the output was either 1 or 0.  When something in the 
middle was output it tended not to be precise.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "kalmantech" <kalmantech@y...> wrote:
> Has any research on NEAT performance verse float precision
> been done?  We are looking at a number of embedded applications
> and our processing platform is limited to single precision floats.
> 
> Steve
